extent.charseq: violence erupted after Sharon endured withering criticism Monday

ldc_scope.charseq: The violence erupted after Sharon endured withering criticism Monday from members of his own Likud Party over his Cabinet's acceptance of the U.S.-backed ``road map'' peace plan

extent.charseq: Israeli withdrawal from even small parts of the West Bank

ldc_scope.charseq: Sharon indicated a 180-degree turnaround after decades of warning that an Israeli withdrawal from even small parts of the West Bank could endanger Israel's existence

extent.charseq: Israel leave the West Bank and Gaza

ldc_scope.charseq: Palestinians and their dovish Israeli allies routinely use the word ``occupation'' when demanding that Israel leave the West Bank and Gaza and dismantle Jewish settlements
On Sunday, Sharon's Cabinet conditionally approved the ``road map,'' a three-phase plan that begins with a halt to violence and envisages a Palestinian state in the West Bank and Gaza Strip in 2005
Sharon told party critics he was committed to finding a political solution to the conflict, including an Israeli withdrawal from West Bank population centers

Critics have said Sharon's long-held condition that all violence must stop before peace moves is unrealistic and guarantees failure of any peace initiative, including the road map, thus releasing him from the necessity of following through on his remarks

extent.charseq: Israeli withdrawal from West Bank population centers

ldc_scope.charseq: Sharon told party critics he was committed to finding a political solution to the conflict, including an Israeli withdrawal from West Bank population centers
